title: datalad_neuroimaging.__file__ can be not absolute
body:
#### What is the problem?
I have been chasing following failure on a local installation for a while:
```
======================================================================
ERROR: datalad_neuroimaging.tests.test_bids2scidata.test_minimal
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nose/case.py", line 197, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad-master/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 493, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (d,)), **kw)
  File "datalad_neuroimaging/tests/test_bids2scidata.py", line 113, in test_minimal
    repo_url='http://example.com',
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad-master/datalad/distribution/dataset.py", line 439, in apply_func
    return f(**kwargs)
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad-master/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 470, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad-master/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 458, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad-master/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 414, in generator_func
    result_renderer, result_xfm, _result_filter, **_kwargs):
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad-master/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 482, in _process_results
    for res in results:
  File "datalad_neuroimaging/bids2scidata.py", line 678, in __call__
    itmpl = open(itmpl_path, encoding='utf-8').read()
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'datalad_neuroimaging/resources/isatab/scidata_bids_investigator.txt'
```
and it seems due to the fact that in that run, when I run it via
```shell
DATALAD_TESTS_SSH=1 DATALAD_TESTS_TEMP_KEEP=1 python -m nose -s -v datalad datalad_crawler datalad_neuroimaging
```
from `datalad-neuroimaging` repository using local virtualenv which has all others installed into it (in develop mode), then `datalad_neuroimaging.__file__` is relative to that path (although cwd is different) and thus loading fails... seems to be sufficient to have `datalad_crawler` (without `datalad`) in the above invocation... 

if any obvious idea what is going on -- I am all ears
